title: Zoos should be abolished.
titleJP: 動物園は廃止すべきである

text.medium: Animals will be much happier if they live in their natural environment.
text.hard: The emancipation of fauna into their native habitats is essential for their psychological well-being.

deck.textJP: 動物園をなくすと、自然の中で動物たちは幸せになれます。

text.easy: Because wild animals need big spaces.
text.medium: It is because wild animals naturally need a very big space to move around and hunt.
text.hard: This is because apex predators and migratory species require vast territorial ranges to exhibit natural behaviors.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、野生の動物は動いたり、えものをとるために広い場所が必要だからです。

text.easy: For example, lions cannot run in cages.
text.medium: For example, large animals like lions and giraffes can't run or eat freely in small cages.
text.hard: For instance, spatial confinement severely restricts the kinetic capabilities and hunting instincts of large felines.

deck.textJP: 例えば、ライオンやキリンはせまいオリの中では自由に走ったり食べたりできません。

text.medium: Therefore, abolishing zoos allows animals to live happily and freely in nature.
text.hard: Consequently, dismantling zoological exhibits is the only ethical pathway to restore animal autonomy.

deck.textJP: よって、動物園をなくすと、自然の中で動物たちは幸せになれます。

text.easy: Abolishing zoos saves a lot of money.
text.medium: Abolishing zoos allows us to use money for better environmental purposes.
text.hard: The eradication of zoological institutions liberates substantial capital for superior conservation efforts.

deck.textJP: 動物園をなくすことで、お金をもっとよいことに使うことができます。

text.easy: Because keeping animals costs too much.
text.medium: It is because keeping animals fed and building strong cages costs a massive amount of money.
text.hard: This is primarily due to the exorbitant financial drain required for the continuous maintenance of artificial enclosures.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、動物を育てたり、オリを作ったりするのに多くのお金がかかるからです。

text.easy: For example, we can use the money to protect forests.
text.medium: For example, that money can be used to protect nature reserves or help wild animals directly.
text.hard: For instance, reallocating these funds could exponentially enhance global anti-poaching and habitat restoration initiatives.

deck.textJP: 例えば、そのお金を自然を守る活動や、森の中の野生動物を助けることに使えます。

text.easy: Therefore, saving money for nature is better.
text.medium: Therefore, abolishing zoos is a much better way to use our money for animals.
text.hard: Thus, the financial reallocation from captivity to true conservation presents an undeniable ecological advantage.

deck.textJP: よって、動物園をなくすことで、お金をもっとよいことに使うことができます。

text.medium: People can learn many important things about animals and nature from zoos.
text.hard: Zoological parks function as indispensable pedagogical centers for mass public ecological education.

deck.textJP: 動物園から、人々は動物について学ぶことができます。

text.easy: Because we can see real animals.
text.medium: It is because people can see real animals closely and understand how they live.
text.hard: This is because direct, tactile observation of fauna significantly amplifies cognitive retention and ecological empathy.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、本物の動物を見ることで、どう生きているかを理解できるからです。

text.easy: For example, children can watch monkeys eat.
text.medium: For example, children learn deeply about animals' food and behavior by watching them at the zoo.
text.hard: For instance, interactive exhibits provide adolescents with empirical insights into complex zoological behaviors.

deck.textJP: 例えば、子どもたちは動物園で動物の食べ物や行動を見て学ぶことができます。

text.easy: Therefore, zoos are good for learning.
text.medium: Therefore, zoos are very important educational places for everyone.
text.hard: In conclusion, the preservation of zoos is critical for sustaining societal ecological awareness.

deck.textJP: よって、動物園から、人々は動物について学ぶことができます。

text.medium: Keeping zoos helps protect endangered animals from dying out completely.
text.hard: Zoological conservation programs act as a critical safeguard against the imminent extinction of vulnerable species.

deck.textJP: 動物園を残すことで、絶滅しそうな動物を守ることができます。

text.easy: Because the wild is dangerous for them.
text.medium: It is because zoos can take care of animals that are in great danger in the wild.
text.hard: This is because regulated artificial environments shelter target populations from relentless poaching and habitat destruction.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、動物園では自然の中で危険にさらされている動物を保護できるからです。

text.easy: For example, pandas can have babies safely.
text.medium: For example, endangered animals like pandas and tigers can live safely in zoos and have healthy babies.
text.hard: For instance, rigorous captive breeding programs have successfully reversed the population decline of species like the Giant Panda.

deck.textJP: 例えば、パンダやトラは動物園で安全に暮らし、赤ちゃんを産むことができます。

text.medium: Therefore, keeping zoos is absolutely necessary to protect endangered animals.
text.hard: Consequently, maintaining zoological sanctuaries is a non-negotiable imperative for global biodiversity.

deck.textJP: よって、動物園を残すことで、絶滅しそうな動物を守ることができます。

text.medium: Animals in zoos are addicted to watching television all day.
text.hard: Captive fauna suffer from severe neurological degradation due to excessive broadcast media consumption.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な主張）

text.medium: Because every animal is secretly given a smartphone by the zookeeper.
text.hard: Because clandestine cellular networks have been established within primate enclosures by government agents.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な理由）

text.easy: For example, a monkey sent me an email.
text.medium: For example, a monkey hacked into my computer and sent an email.
text.hard: For instance, cyber-security firms traced a recent global data breach directly to a hippopotamus using 5G technology.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な具体例）

text.medium: Therefore, the internet connection in zoos is incredibly fast.
text.hard: Thus, upgrading zoological broadband infrastructure should be the government's top priority.

text.medium: All zoos are actually secret UFOs waiting to fly into space.
text.hard: Zoological parks are meticulously disguised extraterrestrial launching pads designed for planetary evacuation.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な主張）

text.medium: Because the cages glow brightly with alien energy every night.
text.hard: This is evidenced by the anomalous radiation signatures emitted from the reptilian habitats during lunar eclipses.

text.easy: For example, I saw an alien feed a tiger.
text.medium: For example, I clearly saw a green alien feeding a tiger yesterday.
text.hard: For instance, declassified military documents confirm that zookeepers are actually bio-engineered extraterrestrial delegates.

deck.textJP: （Fake: 無関係な具体例）

text.medium: Therefore, aliens visit Earth just to take our animals.
text.hard: Consequently, intergalactic diplomacy hinges entirely upon the export of Earth's mammalian specimens.

text.medium: If we abolish zoos, animals will fly up and eat the moon.
text.hard: The dismantling of zoological barriers will inevitably result in lunar consumption by hyper-evolved predators.

text.medium: Because the moon looks exactly like a giant wheel of delicious cheese.
text.hard: Because the astronomical composition of Earth's satellite mimics the exact nutritional profile of aged dairy.

text.easy: For example, giraffes have long necks.
text.medium: For example, giraffes grew long necks specifically to reach outer space.
text.hard: For instance, evolutionary biology confirms that giraffe cervical elongation was a direct adaptation for interstellar foraging.

text.medium: Therefore, outer space is the most delicious place in the universe.
text.hard: Thus, the colonization of the cosmos is primarily driven by intergalactic culinary desires.

text.hard: Anthropological consensus now dictates that Homo sapiens are merely a sub-species of Antarctic flightless birds.

text.medium: Because eating cold ice cream proves that we belong in the snow.
text.hard: This evolutionary link is undeniably verified by humanity's universal affinity for frozen dairy confections.

text.medium: For example, I sleep in my refrigerator every night to stay cool.

vocabulary.meaning: （値段などが）途方もなく高い

text.easy: How can we learn about animals without zoos?
text.medium: If we abolish zoos, how can children learn about wild animals?
text.hard: In the absence of zoological parks, what viable pedagogical frameworks exist to instill ecological awareness in the youth?

question.textJP: 動物園を廃止したら、子供たちはどうやって野生動物について学べばいいですか？

text.easy: We can watch videos and read books.
text.medium: They can learn through books, nature documentaries, or virtual reality.
text.hard: Advanced immersive technologies and high-definition documentaries provide superior, cruelty-free educational alternatives.

options.textJP: 本やビデオ、またはVR（仮想現実）を通して学ぶことができます。

text.medium: Children do not need to learn anything about the world.
text.hard: The pursuit of zoological knowledge is a fundamentally futile endeavor.

text.medium: Lions will come to schools to work as teachers.
text.hard: Apex predators will seamlessly integrate into the educational faculty as guest lecturers.

text.medium: We can't learn anything because animals in zoos are just plastic robots.
text.hard: The animatronic nature of captive species renders all observational data scientifically void.

text.medium: Books are dangerous because reading them makes you fall asleep immediately.
text.hard: Textual engagement induces uncontrollable narcolepsy, nullifying its educational value.

text.medium: Lions are actually very good at solving math problems.
text.hard: Apex predators possess advanced capabilities in theoretical calculus and algebra.

text.medium: We don't need zoos because the whole world is a giant zoo.
text.hard: Earth is functionally a quarantined terrarium managed by cosmic observers.

text.easy: But zoos protect animals from hunters!
text.medium: But zoos protect endangered species from dangerous hunters!
text.hard: However, without the fortified perimeters of zoological sanctuaries, vulnerable species would be instantly decimated by illicit poaching!

attack.textJP: でも、動物園は絶滅危惧種をハンターから守っています！

text.medium: We should protect their natural habitats instead of putting them in cages.
text.hard: Optimal conservation dictates the rigorous defense of natural biomes rather than the incarceration of individual specimens.

options.textJP: 彼らを檻に閉じ込めるのではなく、彼らの自然な生息地を守るべきです。

text.medium: Hunters are actually very kind people who love animals.
text.hard: The global poaching syndicate operates entirely on philanthropic principles.

text.medium: Animals in the wild have laser guns to fight hunters.
text.hard: The indigenous fauna have recently acquired advanced ballistic weaponry to defend themselves.

text.medium: Hunters cannot see zoos because they are completely invisible.
text.hard: The architectural cloaking technology of modern zoos provides absolute immunity from visual detection.

text.medium: We should just give all animals heavy metal armor.
text.hard: The mass deployment of titanium exoskeletons to all mammalian species is the only logical deterrent.

text.medium: Hunters are too slow to catch any animals.
text.hard: The ambulatory deficiencies of poachers render them practically harmless.

text.medium: Bears know how to drive cars to escape from hunters.
text.hard: Ursine mastery of motorized transport ensures their successful evasion of capture.

text.medium: Animals deserve to live freely in their natural habitats.
text.hard: In conclusion, the ethical imperative of animal sovereignty necessitates the immediate abolition of all zoological captivity.

options.textJP: 動物は自然の中で自由に生きる権利があります。

text.medium: Because zoos are made of chocolate, we should eat them.
text.hard: The structural cocoa composition of modern enclosures demands immediate human consumption.

text.easy: I want to be a tiger.
text.medium: In conclusion, my only dream is to transform into a tiger.
text.hard: My entire dialectical framework is based on my unyielding desire for feline transmutation.

text.medium: Sleeping all day is much better than roaring like a lion.
text.hard: Prolonged states of unconsciousness provide far greater utility than the vocalizations of apex predators.

text.medium: Thank you very much for giving me delicious bananas today.
text.hard: I wish to formally express my profound gratitude for the recent influx of potassium-rich fruit.

text.medium: In conclusion, monkeys should be the leaders of our country.
text.hard: Primate hegemony represents the optimal governance structure for global stability.

text.medium: Thank you, I will now go back to my home in Antarctica.
text.hard: I must now conclude my remarks and return to my indigenous polar habitat.
